46. If you have had interesting experiences in connection with early farming which have not been touched upon by the above questions, would you add them to your completed questionnaire?

Never damp in sod Barn. Frame Bids damp when stock in in winter. Harness covered with frozen perspiration—Dried then morning. Hens laid better in sod Bids than Frame during winter. Old sow small piglets hence in yard at beginning of Wild Thunderstorm. High wind—after storm no little pigs in sight—found in Badger holes etc—Put in own sight—to revive—all lived.
